fine_dining.name: Spondi
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant dining in a historic neoclassical building with a charming courtyard
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book well in advance, especially for courtyard seating; specify dietary restrictions when booking
fine_dining.local_tips: Consistently ranked among Greece's best restaurants; known for exceptional service and wine list; offers a refined dining experience away from the main tourist crowds.

fine_dining.name: Varoulko Seaside
fine_dining.atmosphere: Stylish waterfront dining with stunning views of Mikrolimano marina
fine_dining.booking_tips: Request a table by the water for the best views; popular for special occasions
fine_dining.local_tips: Michelin-starred seafood restaurant by renowned chef Lefteris Lazarou; offers creative takes on Greek seafood; accessible via taxi/tram from central Athens; perfect for a special seaside dinner.

fine_dining.name: Hytra
fine_dining.atmosphere: Sleek rooftop restaurant with panoramic Acropolis and city views
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book a table on the terrace during warmer months for incredible views; also has an indoor dining area
fine_dining.local_tips: Offers both fine dining and a more casual bistro menu; known for creative cocktails and modern interpretations of Greek classics; combines culture (at Stegi) with gastronomy.

casual_dining.name: O Kostas (Syntagma Square location)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Tiny, legendary souvlaki joint with standing room only
casual_dining.booking_tips: Go early (before 1pm) as they often sell out by mid-afternoon; cash only; be prepared for a queue
casual_dining.local_tips: Considered by many to serve the best traditional souvlaki in Athens; simple menu, high-quality ingredients; an authentic Athenian experience.

casual_dining.name: Avli Tou Thissiou
casual_dining.atmosphere: Charming taverna with a beautiful courtyard and Acropolis views
casual_dining.reservation_needed: Recommended, especially for tables with views
casual_dining.booking_tips: Ask for a table with an Acropolis view when booking
casual_dining.local_tips: Classic Greek taverna experience in a picturesque setting; popular with both locals and tourists; great spot for a relaxed dinner after visiting the Acropolis or Ancient Agora.

casual_dining.name: To Kafeneio
casual_dining.atmosphere: Traditional, cozy kafeneio (coffee house/tavern) in Plaka
casual_dining.booking_tips: Small place, booking advised for evenings
casual_dining.local_tips: Offers a traditional Greek dining experience in the heart of Plaka; excellent for sharing a variety of mezedes (small plates); serves house wine.

casual_dining.name: Nolan
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book well in advance; small space, often fully booked
casual_dining.local_tips: Bib Gourmand recipient; innovative fusion cuisine by chef Sotiris Kontizas; popular with a younger, foodie crowd; creative and delicious dishes.

street_food.name: Koulouri Stands (various locations)
street_food.location: Street corners all over Athens, especially near metro stations
street_food.local_tips: The quintessential Athenian breakfast on the go; look for vendors with fresh, piled-high koulouri; variations include whole wheat or filled versions.

street_food.name: Lukumades
specialties: Loukoumades (Greek Doughnuts) with various toppings (honey & cinnamon, chocolate, gelato)
street_food.local_tips: Modern take on the traditional Greek doughnut; freshly fried and topped to order; popular spot for a sweet treat.

street_food.name: Feyrouz
street_food.local_tips: Excellent quality, flavorful Lebanese/Middle Eastern street food; popular lunch spot; vegetarian options available.

coffee_shops.name: TAF Coffee (The Underdog)
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Award-winning coffee shop focused on quality beans and brewing methods
coffee_shops.local_tips: Internationally recognized coffee shop and roastery; pioneers of the specialty coffee scene in Athens; great for serious coffee lovers; located near Omonia.

coffee_shops.name: Little Kook
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Extravagantly decorated cafe with constantly changing fairytale themes
coffee_shops.local_tips: An Instagram favorite; expect queues, especially on weekends; over-the-top decorations cover the entire building and street; fun for families and those seeking a unique visual experience.

coffee_shops.name: Yiasemi
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Charming, rustic cafe with iconic steps seating in Plaka
coffee_shops.local_tips: Famous for its cushions laid out on the steps of Mnisikleous street; very popular and picturesque spot in Plaka; great place to relax and people-watch.

bars.name: The Clumsies
bars.atmosphere: Stylish multi-space bar, frequently listed among the World's 50 Best Bars
bars.local_tips: One of Athens' most famous bars; offers exceptional cocktails in a sophisticated yet relaxed setting; attracts a trendy crowd; located downtown.

bars.name: Baba Au Rum
bars.atmosphere: Cozy, eclectic bar with a focus on rum culture; also listed among World's 50 Best Bars
bars.local_tips: Another top-tier Athenian cocktail bar; great atmosphere and music; knowledgeable bartenders; perfect for rum enthusiasts and lovers of well-crafted cocktails.

bars.name: Brettos Bar
bars.atmosphere: Iconic, colourful bar with walls lined with illuminated bottles
bars.local_tips: Athens' oldest distillery (since 1909); located in Plaka; famous for its visually stunning interior; great place to sample traditional Greek spirits like Ouzo and Tsipouro.

bars.name: A for Athens
bars.atmosphere: Popular rooftop bar directly facing the Acropolis above Monastiraki Square
bars.local_tips: Offers arguably one of the best direct views of the Acropolis, especially when illuminated at night; gets very crowded; located in the A for Athens hotel.

food_tours.name: Athens Street Food Walking Tour
highlights: Visit to the Varvakios Agora (Central Market)
Exploring hidden culinary gems in Psyrri/Monastiraki
food_tours.booking_tips: Book online in advance; wear comfortable shoes; come hungry; great introduction to Athenian street food culture.

food_tours.name: Greek Food Discovery in Plaka
highlights: Sampling Greek cheeses, olives, olive oil
Visiting traditional food shops and tavernas in Plaka
food_tours.booking_tips: Focuses more on seated tastings and traditional products than just street food; explores the historic Plaka district; often includes wine or ouzo tasting.

food_tours.name: Athens Evening Food Tour with Wine Tasting
highlights: Tasting modern and traditional Greek dishes
food_tours.booking_tips: Evening tour combining food exploration with insights into Athenian nightlife; includes multiple stops for different courses; good way to discover local wines.

cooking_classes.name: Traditional Greek Cooking Class & Dinner
includes: Hands-on cooking, all ingredients, recipes, full dinner with wine
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Often includes a visit to the central market; great way to learn fundamental Greek recipes; book in advance; vegetarian options usually available.

cooking_classes.name: Greek Pies (Pita) Workshop
what_you_learn: Preparing fillings for Spanakopita (spinach pie), Tiropita (cheese pie)
Techniques for assembling different types of pies
includes: Hands-on class, ingredients, tasting of pies made
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Focuses on a beloved category of Greek cuisine; practical skills to take home; some classes focus on specific regional pies.

markets.name: Varvakios Agora (Central Market)
highlights: Fish Market (huge variety of fresh seafood)
markets.hours: Approx. 7 AM - 6 PM (Mon-Sat), Fish/Meat sections close earlier
markets.local_tips: A vibrant, bustling, and somewhat intense experience; wear closed-toe shoes; see butchers and fishmongers at work; small eateries within the market serve fresh, simple food; great place for photography and observing local life.

markets.name: Evripidou Street Spice Market
markets.hours: Shop hours vary, generally Mon-Sat business hours
markets.location: Evripidou Street (off Athinas Street, near Central Market)
markets.local_tips: The 'spice street' of Athens; aromatic and colourful; find specialty food products; Karamanlidika tou Fani is a famous deli/taverna here specializing in cured meats and cheeses.

markets.name: Monastiraki Flea Market
markets.hours: Daily, but most extensive on Sunday mornings
markets.location: Ifestou Street and surrounding area, Monastiraki
markets.local_tips: More tourist-oriented than Varvakios, but still lively; Sunday is the main flea market day with more vendors selling antiques and second-hand goods; browse for souvenirs, leather goods, etc.; find some food stalls and cafes nearby.

spring: Fresh Peas and Broad Beans (often cooked with lamb - Arni Fricase)
Easter specialties like Magiritsa (lamb offal soup) and Tsoureki (sweet braided bread)
summer: Gemista (Tomatoes and Peppers stuffed with rice and herbs)
Horiatiki Salata (Greek Salad) at its peak with ripe tomatoes
autumn: Horta (Wild Greens) - boiled and served with lemon and olive oil
Quince (Kydoni) - often made into spoon sweets or baked
winter: Fasolada (White Bean Soup - considered a national dish)
Lahanodolmades (Cabbage Rolls stuffed with meat and rice in avgolemono sauce)
